section.title: Introduction
section.abstract: Why were you initially drawn into formal methods?

sbcol.subsec: The distinction between formal and rigorous methods is drawn.

I was acquainted with formal logic and had spent 5 years in software development before I formally studied maths and philosophy as an undergraduate. When I began undergraduate mathematics I already had a conception of proof which had been corrupted by exposure to the ideas of Bertrand Russell, and was reluctant to settle even then for informal proofs.
